name: 1,1'-thiocarbonyldi-2(1h)-pyridone
Reason: 1,1'-thiocarbonyldi-2(1H)-pyridone has a melting point that we can compare to 1,2-propanediol, which has a melting point of around 50 degrees Celsius. The basic unit we can compare to is 1,2-propanediol, which has a melting point of around 50 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 1,1'-thiocarbonyldi-2(1H)-pyridone will affect its melting point: (1) Two phenyl groups, which could each add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The thiocarbonyl group (C(=S)) introduces a sulfur atom, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, adding about +10; (3) The pyridine ring (n2ccccc2) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at +20. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
